<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

I am not sure if this is a quantum-espresso or elpa issue but quantum-espresso is misidentifying the version of elpa.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack spec quantum-espresso +elpa | grep elpa
quantum-espresso+elpa
quantum-espresso@6.7%gcc@8.4.0+elpa~environ~epw+mpi~openmp+patch~qmcpack+scalapack hdf5=none arch=linux-centos7-broadwell
    ^elpa@2020.05.001%gcc@8.4.0~cuda~openmp cuda_arch=none patches=d0e1000059345bc33eb9ada361670f27142b8d3fba2f41e1ba06703850810258 arch=linux-centos7-broadwell

```
```console
$ spack install quantum-espresso+elpa
...
3 errors found in build log:
     608    f951: Warning: Nonexistent include directory '../ELPA/src' [-Wmissing-include-dirs]
     609    f951: Warning: Nonexistent include directory '../EIGENSOLVER_GPU/lib_eigsolve' [-Wmissing-include-dirs]
     610    dspev_drv.f90:604:9:
     611    
     612          use elpa1
     613             1
  >> 614    Fatal Error: Can't open module file 'elpa1.mod' for reading at (1): No such file or directory
     615    compilation terminated.
  >> 616    make[1]: *** [dspev_drv.o] Error 1
     617    make[1]: Leaving directory `/tmp/gpjohnsn/spack-stage/spack-stage-quantum-espresso-6.7-oxwzcywdwag2orrdjbu6m6j5vfndbx6s/spack-s
            rc/LAXlib'
  >> 618    make: *** [libla] Error 1

```
Looking at the build log I see:
```
checking ELPA... configure: WARNING: *** Invalid ELPA version, defaulting to 2016
```
### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->
```console
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.1-2156-291a2b5
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-centos7-broadwell
* **Concretizer:** original
```
<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

### Additional information

<!-- Please upload the following files. They should be present in the stage directory of the failing build. Also upload any config.log or similar file if one exists. 
* [spack-build-out.txt]()
* [spack-build-env.txt]() -->

<!-- Some packages have maintainers who have volunteered to debug build failures. Run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mention them here if they exist. -->
maintainers: @naromero77
### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [ ] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: Installation issue: quantum-espresso does not build with elpa
